preloaded/ententen21_tt31:
Corpus language: English  

Core token structures (each token is a record):  
- **word** – surface form  
- **tag** – TreeTagger POS tag (modified for Sketch Engine)  
- **lempos** – lemma plus POS suffix (e.g. “run‑v”)  
- **pos** – same as tag, kept for convenience  
- **lemma** – base form of the word  
- **lempos_lc**, **lemma_lc**, **lc** – lower‑cased versions of the three fields above  

Additional hierarchical structures:  
- **g**, **s** – generic grouping levels (no attributes)  
- **p** – paragraph level, attribute **heading** (text of the heading)  
- **doc** – document level, attributes:  
  * url – full URL  
  * title – document title  
  * wiki_categories – Wikipedia categories (if any)  
  * urldomain – full domain (e.g. news.blogs.cnn.com)  
  * website – short domain (e.g. cnn.com)  
  * crawl_date, modified_date – dates (ISO)  
  * tld – top‑level domain (com, org…)  
  * wiki_translations – Wikipedia language links  
  * modified_month, modified_year – numeric month/year of last modification  
  * topic – thematic label  
  * tld_expl – English‑speaking country TLD (uk, us…)  
  * domain_distance – distance from seed domains (numeric)  
  * genre – genre label (news, blog, etc.)  
  * src – source identifier  
  * crawl_year – year of crawling  

### POS tags (TreeTagger with Sketch Engine modifications) and meanings  

| Tag | Description | Example |
|-----|-------------|---------|
| CC  | coordinating conjunction | and |
| CD  | cardinal number | 1, one |
| CDZ | possessive numeral | one's |
| DT  | determiner | the |
| EX  | existential “there” | there |
| FW  | foreign word | d’hoevre |
| IN  | preposition or subordinating conjunction | in, of, like |
| IN/that | “that” as subordinator | that |
| JJ  | adjective | green |
| JJR | adjective comparative | greener |
| JJS | adjective superlative | greenest |
| LS  | list marker | 1) |
| MD  | modal verb | could, will |
| NN  | noun, singular or mass | table |
| NNS | noun plural | tables |
| NNSZ| possessive noun plural | people's |
| NNZ | possessive noun singular | year's |
| NP  | proper noun singular | John |
| NPS | proper noun plural | Vikings |
| NPSZ| possessive proper noun plural | Boys' |
| NPZ | possessive proper noun singular | Britain's |
| PDT | predeterminer | both |
| PP  | personal pronoun | I, he |
| PPZ | possessive pronoun | my, his |
| RB  | adverb | however |
| RBR | adverb comparative | better |
| RBS | adverb superlative | best |
| RP  | particle | up (in “give up”) |
| SENT| sentence‑final punctuation | . ! ? |
| SYM | other symbols | / = * |
| TO  | infinitive marker “to” (only when infinitival) | to |
| UH  | interjection | uhh |
| VB  | verb “be”, base | be |
| VBD | verb “be”, past | was |
| VBG | verb “be”, gerund | being |
| VBN | verb “be”, past participle | been |
| VBP | verb “be”, present non‑3rd | am, are |
| VBZ | verb “be”, 3rd‑sg present | is |
| VH  | verb “have”, base | have |
| VHD | verb “have”, past | had |
| VHG | verb “have”, gerund | having |
| VHN | verb “have”, past participle | had |
| VHP | verb “have”, present non‑3rd | have |
| VHZ | verb “have”, 3rd‑sg present | has |
| VV  | other verbs, base | take |
| VVD | other verbs, past | took |
| VVG | other verbs, gerund | taking |
| VVN | other verbs, past participle | taken |
| VVP | other verbs, present non‑3rd | take |
| VVZ | other verbs, 3rd‑sg present | takes |
| WDT | wh‑determiner | which |
| WP  | wh‑pronoun | who, what |
| WPZ | possessive wh‑pronoun | whose |
| WRB | wh‑adverb | where, when |
| Z   | possessive ending “'s” | ’s |

**Key differences from the Penn tagset**  
- “be” and “have” have dedicated tags (VB/VH) separate from other verbs (VV).  
- Proper nouns use NP/NPS instead of NNP/NNPS.  
- SENT marks sentence‑final punctuation; other punctuation retains its own tags.  
- Token “to” is tagged IN when a preposition, TO only when infinitival.  
- Indefinite articles “a”/“an” are both lemmatized as “a”.  
- Possessive clitics are re‑tokenized and receive the Z/PPZ/WPZ tags (e.g. “John’s” → “John” + “’s”).  

### Lempos suffixes (used in the **lempos** field)  

- adjective → “‑j”  
- adverb → “‑a”  
- conjunction → “‑c”  
- noun → “‑n”  
- numeral → “‑m”  
- preposition → “‑i”  
- pronoun → “‑d”  
- verb → “‑v”  

Thus a token with lemma “run” and POS verb will have lempos “run‑v”.  

### Annotation shortcuts for CQL  

The corpus defines the following regex‑based annotations (usable in CQL with the “annotation” name):  

- adjective: `J.*`  
- adverb: `RB.?`  
- conjunction: `CC`  
- determiner: `DT`  
- noun: `N.*`  
- numeral: `CD`  
- particle: `RP`  
- preposition: `IN`  
- pronoun: `PP.?`  
- verb: `V.*`  

These can be referenced as `[annotation="adjective"]`, etc.  

### Word‑sketch (grammatical relation) patterns  

Relations are expressed with the placeholder **%w** for the target word. Typical relation names (as they appear in the Sketch Engine UI) include:  

- “%w is a …”, “%w’s …”, “… is a %w”  
- “adjective predicates of %w”, “adjectives after %w”, “adjectives modified by %w”  
- “adverbs modified by %w”  
- “as reflexive”  
- “complements of %w”, “in passive”, “infinitive objects of %w”, “it’s %w to …”  
- “modifiers of %w”, “nouns modified by %w”  
- “objects of %w” (including variants with particles: across, along, apart, around, aside, away, down, in, off, on, open, out, over, through, unto, up, upon, whole)  
- “particles after %w” (with or without object)  
- “possessors of %w”, “prepositional phrases”, “pronominal objects/possessors/subjects of %w”  
- “subjects of %w”, “subjects of be %w”  
- “verbs before %w”, “verbs complemented by %w”, “verbs modified by %w”, “verbs with %w as object”, “verbs with %w as subject”  
- “verbs with particle X and %w as object” (X = across, along, …, whole)  
- “wh‑words following %w”  

When writing CQL, the relation can be accessed via the `rel` attribute, e.g. `[rel="objects of %w"]`.  

### Practical CQL tips  

1. **POS filtering** – use the `tag` or `pos` field, e.g. `[tag="NN"]` for singular nouns, `[tag="VVG"]` for gerund verbs.  
2. **Lemma/lempos** – to match a lemma irrespective of case, use `[lemma_lc="run"]`; to restrict to a POS, combine with lempos suffix, e.g. `[lempos="run‑v"]`.  
3. **Case‑insensitive word form** – `[lc="apple"]`.  
4. **Document metadata** – filter on any `doc` attribute, e.g. `[doc.genre="news"]` or `[doc.crawl_year="2023"]`.  
5. **Paragraph headings** – `[p.heading="Introduction"]`.  
6. **Word‑sketch relations** – to retrieve objects of a verb, use `[rel="objects of %w"]` together with a target word constraint, e.g. `["word"="eat"] [rel="objects of %w"]`.  
7. **Annotation shortcuts** – `[annotation="verb"]` is equivalent to `[tag="V.*"]`.  

These elements together provide all necessary information to construct accurate CQL queries for this English TreeTagger‑based corpus.
preloaded/frtenten22_fl4:
Corpus language: French (FreeLing morphological tagger, EAGLES‑based).

**Structures (token‑level)**
- word – the surface form.
- tag – full morphological tag (see tagset tables).
- lempos – lemma + POS suffix (e.g. “marcher‑v”).
- lempos_lc – lempos in lowercase.
- lemma – lemma.
- lemma_lc – lemma in lowercase.
- gender_lemma – lemma with gender information.
- gender_guess – gender guessed by the tagger.
- number_guess – number guessed by the tagger.
- lc – lowercase word.
- tags – composed tag (alternative representation).
- morphemes – morphemic decomposition.
- shorttag – shortened version of tag.
- pos – POS category only (first character of tag).

**Higher‑level structures**
- g – generic grouping.
- s – generic grouping.
- p – paragraph; attributes: heading, lang_diff.
- doc – document; attributes:
  url, title, wiki_categories, urldomain, website, crawl_date,
  modified_date (unreliable), tld, wiki_translations,
  modified_month (unreliable), modified_year (unreliable),
  topic, domain_distance, genre, crawl_year, src.

All structures can be addressed in CQL with the syntax `[structure="value"]` or `[structure.attribute="value"]`.

**Annotation shortcuts (regex on tag)**
- adjective  `A.*`
- adverb   `R.*`
- conjunction `C.*`
- determiner `D.*`
- interjection `I.*`
- noun    `N.*`
- numeral  `Z.*`
- preposition `S.*`
- pronoun  `P.*`
- verb    `V.*`

**lempos suffixes (used in lempos and lempos_lc)**
- adjective `-j`
- adverb  `-r`
- conjunction `-c`
- noun   `-n`
- numeral  `-m`
- preposition `-i`
- pronoun  `-p`
- verb   `-v`

**FreeLing French POS tagset (positions are 0‑based, each position = a morphological feature)**  

*Adjective* `A` category; position 1 type (O ordinal, Q qualificative, P possessive); 2 degree (S superlative, V evaluative); 3 gen (F fem, M masc, C common); 4 num (S sg, P pl, N inv); 5 possessor person (1,2,3); 6 possessor num (S,P,N).

*Conjunction* `C` category; 1 type (C coordinating, S subordinating).

*Determiner* `D` category; 1 type (A article, D demonstrative, E exclamative, I indefinite, T interrogative, N numeral, P possessive, R relative); 2 person (1,2,3); 3 gen (F,M,C,N); 4 num (S,P,N); 5 possessor num (S,P).

*Noun* `N` category; 1 type (C common, P proper); 2 gen (F,M,C,N); 3 num (S,P,N); 4 neclass (S person, G location, O organization, V other); 5 nesubclass (not used); 6 degree (A augmentative, D diminutive).

*Pronoun* `P` category; 1 type (D demonstrative, E exclamative, I indefinite, T interrogative, N numeral, P personal, X possessive, R relative); 2 person (1,2,3); 3 gen (F,M,C,N); 4 num (S,P,N); 5 case (N nom, A acc, D dat, O obl); 6 polite (P yes).

*Adverb* `R` category; 1 type (N negative, G general).

*Adposition* `S` category; 1 type (P preposition).

*Verb* `V` category; 1 type (M main, A aux, S semiaux); 2 mood (I indic, S subj, M imper, P partic, G gerund, N inf); 3 tense (P pres, I imp, F fut, S past, C cond); 4 person (1,2,3); 5 num (S,P); 6 gen (F,M,C,N).

*Number* `Z` category; 1 type (d partitive, m currency, p percentage, u unit).

*Date* `W` category.

*Interjection* `I` category.

**Non‑positional tags (punctuation)**
Examples: `Fd` colon, `Fc` comma, `Flt` open curly, `Fla` close curly, `Fs` etc., `Fat` open exclamation, `Faa` close exclamation, `Fg` hyphen, `Fz` other, `Fpt` open parenthesis, `Fpa` close parenthesis, `Ft` percentage, `Fp` period, `Fit` open question, `Fia` close question, `Fe` quotation, `Frc` close quotation, `Fra` open quotation, `Fx` semicolon, `Fh` slash, `Fct` open square, `Fca` close square. Each has attributes `pos="punctuation"` and `type` (as shown).

**Word‑sketch (grammatical relation) patterns**
The corpus provides the following relation labels that can be used in word‑sketch queries (e.g. `[%w]` or `adjectives modified by "%w"`):
- “%w is a …”, “... is a %w”, “adjective predicates of %w”, “adjectives after %w”, “adjectives modified by %w”, “aller %w”, “devoir %w”, “infinitive objects of %w”, “less %w than …”, “modifiers of %w”, “more”, “noun modifiers of %w”, “nouns modified by %w”, “nouns modified by noun %w”, “objects of %w”, “pouvoir %w”, “prepositional phrases”, “prepositions preceding noun/nouns after preposition”, “pronominal objects of %w”, “pronominal possessors of %w”, “pronominal subjects of %w”, “pronoun is %w”, “subjects of %w”, “subjects of être %w”, “venir de %w”, “verbs before %w”, “verbs modified by %w”, “verbs with %w as object”, “verbs with %w as subject”, “with_definite_article”, “with_indefinite_article”, “être en train de %w”.

**CQL usage notes**
- Tags are matched with regular expressions, e.g. `[tag="N.FS.*"]` selects singular feminine nouns (`N` category, `F` gender, `S` singular). Use straight double quotes.
- POS can be accessed directly via `[pos="N"]` or via the first character of `tag`.
- Lempos suffixes allow POS filtering without consulting `tag`: `[lempos="*‑v"]` for verbs, `[lempos="*‑n"]` for nouns, etc.; case‑insensitive version is `lempos_lc`.
- Document‑level filters use the `doc` structure, e.g. `[doc.genre="news"]` or `[doc.crawl_year="2023"]`.
- Paragraph attributes: `[p.heading="Introduction"]`.
- Gender and number guesses are available for tokens lacking explicit inflection: `[gender_guess="F"]`, `[number_guess="P"]`.
- The `shorttag` field contains a reduced tag (useful for quick POS checks).
- Punctuation can be filtered with `[tag="Fc"]` (comma) or `[tag="Fp"]` (period).

**Language‑specific quirks**
- French nouns have gender (F/M) and number (S/P) encoded in positions 3 and 4 of the tag; adjectives agree in gender and number (positions 3‑4) and may also carry possessive agreement (positions 5‑6).
- Determiners encode type, person, gender, number, and possessor number; these are useful for article‑specific queries.
- Verbs encode mood, tense, person, number, and sometimes gender (participles). The infinitive is indicated by `N` in position 2.
- Pronouns include case information (position 5) which is relevant for subject vs. object queries.
- The tagset does not encode case for nouns (French nouns are case‑neutral), but pronoun case is present.
- Lempos suffixes are a compact way to retrieve POS regardless of the detailed morphological features.

All the above elements are sufficient to construct precise CQL queries for token, sentence, paragraph or document selection, as well as to exploit word‑sketch relations in this French FreeLing‑annotated corpus.
preloaded/cstenten23_mj2:
Corpus language: Czech  

Structures (token‑level)  
- word – the surface form  
- tag – full morphological tag (see tagset description)  
- lempos – lemma + POS suffix (e.g. “dům‑n”)  
- gender_lemma – gender‑specific lemma (e.g. “muž‑M”)  
- lc – word in lowercase  
- lempos_lc – lempos in lowercase  
- lemma – canonical lemma  
- lemma_lc – lemma in lowercase  
- gender_lemma_lc – gender‑specific lemma in lowercase  
- k, g, n, c, p, m, pos – shortcuts for individual attributes (see below)  

Additional structures  
- g – same as above (kept for compatibility)  
- s – sentence identifier (no attributes listed)  
- p – paragraph identifier, attribute **heading** (paragraph heading text)  

Document‑level structure **doc** with attributes:  
url, title, wiki_categories, urldomain, website, crawl_date, modified_date, wiki_translations, modified_month, tld, modified_year, topic, domain_distance, genre, src, crawl_year  

Annotations (CQL shortcuts)  
noun
preloaded/europarl7_en:
Corpus language: English  

Structures (each token is a node):  
- word – the surface form  
- tag – Penn‑Treebank part‑of‑speech tag (see tagset description)  
- lempos – lemma plus POS suffix (e.g. “run‑v”)  
- lemma – canonical lemma (lower‑cased)  
- lemma_lc – lemma in lower case (same as lemma for this corpus)  
- lc – lower‑cased word form  

Additional hierarchical structures:  
- g – generic grouping (no attributes)  
- s – sentence, attribute **id** (sentence identifier)  
- p – paragraph, attribute **id** (paragraph identifier)  
- speaker – attributes **name**, **id**, **language**  
- chapter – attribute **id**  
- document – attributes **id**, **wordcount**  

These structures can be addressed in CQL with the syntax `struct:attribute`.  
Example: `[s.id="12"]` selects tokens belonging to sentence 12.  

POS tagset: English Penn‑Treebank with Sketch Engine modifications (TreeTagger).  
Key tags and meanings (use straight double quotes in CQL, e.g. `[tag="NNS"]`):  

CC coordinating conjunction (and, or)  
CD cardinal number (one, third)  
DT determiner (the, a)  
EX existential there (there)  
FW foreign word (les)  
IN preposition or subordinating conjunction (in, of, like) – the word “to” is tagged **TO** when infinitival, **IN** when prepositional  
JJ adjective (green)  
JJR adjective comparative (greener)  
JJS adjective superlative (greenest)  
LS list marker (1)  
MD modal (could, will)  
NN singular or mass noun (table)  
NNS plural noun (tables)  
NP proper noun singular (John) – replaces NNP  
NPS proper noun plural (Vikings) – replaces NNPS  
PDT predeterminer (both)  
POS possessive ending (’s)  
PP personal pronoun (I, he)  
PPZ possessive pronoun (my, his)  
RB adverb (however)  
RBR adverb comparative (better)  
RBS adverb superlative (best)  
RP particle (up in “give up”)  
SENT sentence‑final punctuation (., !, ?)  
SYM symbol (/ = *)  
TO infinitival marker (to)  
UH interjection (uh)  
VB be, base form (be) – distinct from other verbs  
VH have, base form (have) – distinct from other verbs  
VV other verbs, base form (take)  
VBD past tense (was, took)  
VBG gerund/present participle (being, taking)  
VBN past participle (been, taken)  
VBP non‑3rd‑person singular present (am, are)  
VBZ 3rd‑person singular present (is, takes)  
WDT wh‑determiner (which)  
WP wh‑pronoun (who, what)  
WP$ possessive wh‑pronoun (whose)  
WRB wh‑adverb (where, when)  

Differences to the original Penn set:  
- “be” uses tag **VB**, “have” uses **VH**, all other non‑modal verbs use **VV**.  
- Proper nouns are **NP** / **NPS** (instead of NNP/NNPS).  
- Sentence‑final punctuation is **SENT**.  
- The word “to” is **TO** when infinitival, otherwise **IN**.  

Annotation shortcuts (used in the UI, not CQL):  
adjective → “J.*”  
adverb → “RB.?”  
conjunction → “CC”  
determiner → “DT”  
noun → “N.*”  
numeral → “CD”  
particle → “RP”  
preposition → “IN”  
pronoun → “PP.? ”  
verb → “V.*”  

Lempos suffixes (the part after the hyphen in the lempos field):  
‑j adjective  
‑a adverb  
‑c conjunction  
‑n noun  
‑i preposition  
‑p pronoun  
‑v verb  

Word‑sketch (grammatical relation) labels available for collocation queries:  
adj_comp, adj_comp_of, adj_subject, adj_subject_of, and/or, infin_comp, ing_comp, it+, modifier, modifies, np_adj_comp, np_adj_comp_of, object, object_of, part_across‑x, part_across‑x_obj, part_along‑x, part_along‑x_obj, part_apart‑x, part_apart‑x_obj, part_around‑x, part_around‑x_obj, part_aside‑x, part_aside‑x_obj, part_away‑x, part_away‑x_obj, part_down‑x, part_down‑x_obj, part_in‑x, part_in‑x_obj, part_intrans, part_off‑x, part_off‑x_obj, part_on‑x, part_on‑x_obj, part_open‑x, part_open‑x_obj, part_out‑x, part_out‑x_obj, part_over‑x, part_over‑x_obj, part_through‑x, part_through‑x_obj, part_trans, part_unto‑x, part_unto‑x_obj, part_up‑x, part_up‑x_obj, part_upon‑x, part_upon‑x_obj, part_whole‑x, part_whole‑x_obj, passive, possessed, possessor, pp_… (all prepositional‑phrase relations, e.g. pp_about‑i, pp_obj_about‑i, pp_of‑i, etc.), predicate, predicate_of, pro_object, pro_possessor, pro_subject, reflexive, subject, subject_of, wh_comp.  

CQL tips for this corpus:  
- Refer to token attributes with square brackets, e.g. `[word="run"]`, `[tag="VB"]`, `[lempos="run‑v"]`.  
- Use structural constraints, e.g. `[s.id="5"]` or `[speaker.language="en"]`.  
- When searching for a specific POS, match the full tag string; regular‑expression matching is allowed with `=~`, e.g. `[tag=~"^NN"]` for all noun tags.  
- Lempos suffixes can be filtered directly, e.g. `[lempos=~"-v$"]` for verbs.  
- Word‑sketch relations are accessed via the `rel:` operator in Sketch Engine’s word‑sketch interface; they are not directly searchable in CQL but can be combined with token constraints in a concordance.  

All structures, attributes, tags, lempos suffixes and relation names listed above are the complete set needed to construct correct CQL queries for this English corpus.
